qas.question: How much concern do minority leaders have for campaigning?

answers.text: hardly any major aspect of campaigning that does not engage their attention

qas.question: Outside of Washington how much involvement do minority leaders have in campaigns?

answers.text: travel around the country to speak on behalf of party candidates; and they encourage incumbent colleagues to make significant financial contributions

qas.question: What kind of campaigner is the DCCC?
Who does the DCCC campaign for?

plausible_answers.text: There is hardly any major aspect of campaigning that does not engage their attention

qas.question: How much does the DCCC focus on campaigning?
What kind of candidates are recruited by the DCCC?

plausible_answers.text: to raise and distribute funds to House candidates of their party

qas.question: Why does the DCCC establish leadership PAC's?

context: Provide Campaign Assistance. <a1_0>Minority leaders<a1_0/> are typically <b3_0>energetic and aggressive<b3_0/> campaigners for <b4_0>partisan incumbents and challengers<b4_0/>. <b5_0>There is <a0_0>hardly any major aspect of campaigning that does not engage their attention<b5_0/><a0_0/>. For example, they assist in recruiting <b6_0>qualified<b6_0/> candidates; they establish "leadership PACs" <b7_0>to raise and distribute funds to House candidates of their party<b7_0/>; they try to persuade partisan colleagues not to retire or run for other offices so as to hold down the number of open seats the party would need to defend; they coordinate their campaign activities with congressional and national party campaign committees; they encourage outside groups to back their candidates; they <a2_0>travel around the country to speak on behalf of party candidates; and they encourage incumbent colleagues to make significant financial contributions<a2_0/> to the party's campaign committee. "The amount of time that [Minority Leader] Gephardt is putting in to help the DCCC [Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee] is unheard of," noted a Democratic lobbyist."No DCCC chairman has ever had that kind of support."
